title: 820-3662 not turning on
message:
Good morning, this mac had 1V on the PPBUS, I checked the u7100 terminals 27/28 had high resistance, then I changed the resistors and the u7100, the PPbus is now 12.56V, but the mac won't turn on.


Voltage:
PPBUS 12,56V
PP3V42_G3h 3,39V
PLT_RST_L 0,021V
PM_SYSRST_L 0V;
PM_PCH_PWROK 0V, pulse 100mV
PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK 0V, no pulse.

title: 820-3662 not turning on
message:
Do you get 3V3_S5?
Be aware, this board only turns on with 85W charger, if no battery connected.
Check PM_BATLOW_L level.

title: 820-3662 not turning on
message:
PM_BATLOW_L 3,34V
PP3V3_S5 3,34V
I am using 85W charger.

title: 820-3662 not turning on
message:
3V3_SUS comes high when pressing power button?
Check for pulse at least.

title: 820-3662 not turning on
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 76923, member: 682"]
3V3_SUS comes high when pressing power button?
[/QUOTE]
Yes, this is exactly what happens.

title: 820-3662 not turning on
message: Does it stay high, or just pulse???

title: 820-3662 not turning on
message:
PP3V3_SUS gets 3,34V only when SMC_ONOFF_L is triggered.

Sometimes it turns on when it is tested on battery.

title: 820-3662 not turning on
message:
Try to start in SMC byapss mode.
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of ISL6259.

title: 820-3662 not turning on
message:
17/18 3,5Ohm 2728 20Ohm 
does not accept SMC Bypass.

title: 820-3662 not turning on
message: Once power button is released, 3V3_SUS disappear immediately?

title: 820-3662 not turning on
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 76977, member: 682"]
Once power button is released, 3V3_SUS disappear immediately?
[/QUOTE]
This is exactly what happens.
This test is only possible with the battery connected.
There is a strange sound coming from the PCH.

title: 820-3662 not turning on
message: When trigger SMC_ONOFF_L, do you catch any pulse at L7520, or other big coil?

title: 820-3662 not turning on
message: The only coil that pulses are L7560, it gets loud when you trigger SMC_ONOFF_L.

title: 820-3662 not turning on
message:
Pulsing at L7560???
Didn't say stable 3V3_S5 in some previous post?
"PP3V3_S5 3,34V"

title: 820-3662 not turning on
message:
[QUOTE = "2informaticos, post: 77014, membro: 682"]
"PP3V3_S5 3,34V"
[/CITAR]
DESCULPE.
L7195 5,5v
L7520 0v, SEM PULSO QUANDO ACIONA SMC_ON0FF
L7560 3,34v
L7310, L7320, L7320, L7870, L7630 0V, SEM PULSO QUANDO ACIONA SMC_ON0FF
L7130 12,47v

title: 820-3662 not turning on
message:
PM_RSMRST_L pulses when you trigger SMC_ONOFF_L?
You should note a drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L at same time.

title: 820-3662 not turning on
message:
PM_RSMRST_L 0V, no pulse when SMC_ONOFF is triggered.

PM_PWRBTN_L starts high at 3.39V, when triggering the SMC_ONOFF drops 0.127V.

title: 820-3662 not turning on
message: Reball/change the SMC...

title: 820-3662 not turning on
message:
I replaced the SMC, in tests it showed the image, but when I turned the mac off and on again, it didn't turn on again. I would try a Bios, when I applied voltage to the PP3v3_SUS, it was shorted.
P1V05S0_LL shows 0.002 Ohm. The PCH gets hot when I apply voltage to PP3v3_SUS

title: 820-3662 not turning on
message: PCH is now fried, change it.

title: 820-3662 not turning on
message: Why did this happen?

title: 820-3662 not turning on
message:
Always hard to understand your english.
"I applied voltage to the PP3v3_SUS, it was shorted"
Was there short before injecting voltage?

"P1V05S0_LL shows 0.002 Ohm"
Did you check that before injecting voltage?
